result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio S. Buss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Antonio S. Buss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Antonio S. Buss was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at rate of 25% of prison funds.

superMiscConds.notes: To maintain absolute sobriety during Prison time and extended supervision.
To comply with any treatment, supervision, or medication deemed necessary.
No contact with Monroe Clinic except in case of emergency. If contact must be made in case of emergency, defendant to make contact in company of law enforcement officer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio S. Buss

records.addlTxt:
Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Allen Harlow and Mark Phillip Maciolek.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. PSI writer Allison Ama present in court. 7 days credit on sentence. Mr. Mike Sanders, President/CEO of the Monroe Clinic, representative of victim, makes statement. Reads statement on behalf of victim. No questions for the author of the PSI. Atty Luhman makes statements. Defense makes statements. Defendant makes statement. Sentenced to 4 Years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. $2000 in bond to be refunded to mother, costs to be paid at rate of 25% of prison wages.
Associated with Charge #2
from Debra Hustad LCSW and report from Dr Kenneth Robbins MD
alternate sentencing report
to: Gary Luhman and Mark Maciolek
from Murphy Desmond

5) Green County Victim Input Possible Resolution dated 8-12-15 from Mike Sanders.
Plea Agreement Offered

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 dismissed on prosecutor's motion. Count 2 Defendant pleads No Contest. PSI reports to be submitted in 60 days, (March 21), Sentencing Hearing in 90 days, April 21, 9 a.m. for one hour. Jury Trial Cancelled.

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Back up JT date Feb 3-5, 2016 is a go.  Jury instructions due Jan 22, 2016.

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Mr Luhman is requesting for the matter to be set over. This case is scheduled with another case for a jury trial on the same day. Mr Luhman suggests to set the matter over to see if that case settles, if not the jury trial for this case needs to be re-scheduled.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Matters not resolved. Set for a 3-day jury trial. Set for Jury Trial #2 on January 11, 12 and 13, 2016. Set over for jury trial #1 on February 3, 4, 5, 2015. Panel size 50; 2 alternates; 5 strikes each; note-taking allowed. Discovery has been provided by the State. Motions in Limine to be filed by Oct 30, 2015. Briefs in Opositions to be filed by Nov. 9th, 2015. Bond continues. Hearing set for November 11, 2015 at 2:00pm.

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court by phone means with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek who appeared in court in person. Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Mr Kohl informs the court that the victim has moved to Florida and has to return the Victim Resolution Forms back to the State. Requesting to set matter over till matters are resolved or to schedule a trial. Bond continue.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference at 07-21-2015 02:00 pm

Antonio S. Buss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Mark Phillip Maciolek. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Attorney Mackiolek states that Mr. Buss has been seeing a Human Services Counselor and a psychiatrist for treatment. Need to set out a few months until this is completed.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
